feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
19/6 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the ninth edition:

Andy:
  • A Short Story on Human Error - There is no single root cause or the further back you go in time, the more reasons you'll find that there's a tangled web of lots of little causes, that again have their own causes.
  • Your top 100 unix commands, for science! - Contribute your daily used Unix commands.
  • Rapid Web Development in the Browser using Espresso - Interesting and fast way to push out a prototype.
Floor:
  • svn-git - crash course to svn for (former) git users, written by yours truly.
  • version eye - Follow your libraries and get notified about new versions. Visually neat tool.
  • gist-dep - Anytime you want to re-use code but the amount of code is so small it would be silly to create a library.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
11/6 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the eighth edition:

Tony:
  • PostgreSQL 9.3: What's new - Beta information about the Best RDBMS Ever™
  • Best Google+ Profile Ever - Support the T.S.A.!
  • For More Pair Programming - Get support for your project.
Floor:
  • git log - Bored and tired of the old git log screen? Try this.
  • geo-bootstrap - My new favorite CSS bootstrapper: it has comic sans, funky colors and MC Hammer.
  • Office Pi - GoCardless cooked up a fancy Office Dashboard Pi.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
4/6 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the seventh edition:

Andy:
  • How Go uses Go to build itself - I am always fascinated when a programming language can compile or interpret itself.
  • Afraid of the big nasty gem? - Ever thought about evil code in a RubyGem you use? Or how can I trust software of 3rd parties?
  • http://ascii.io/ - ascii.io is a neat tool to make command-line based screencasts, where you even can copy and paste the text.
Floor:
  • E.V.E. - E.V.E. is a Star Trek / Jarvis type computer written in Python. Run the program, and E.V.E. will activate whenever you say "okay computer," after which you can ask it a question / command.
  • GitLab Summer of Code - GitLab (the open source alternative to GitHub) is a Google Summer of Code project.
  • PyLadies Vienna - As one of the co-organizers of PyLadies Vienna I can't help but promote our beginners course to Python. Spread the word!
  • Raspberry Pi - Learn what other people use their Raspberry Pi for!

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
29/5 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the sixth edition:

Andy:
  • Introduction to Randomness and Random Numbers - A good read on why it is so hard to get a computer generate good random data.
  • Storm SSH - A nifty tool that helps you organizing your SSH config.
  • Rails Girls summer of code - Support them as much as YOU can. It's a great and important project.
Tony:
  • logstash - a tool for managing events and logs. In JRuby!
  • The Principles of OOD - Object Oriented Design. Uncle Bob Martin. 'nuff said.
Floor:
  • content management with version control 1 - I wrote a little something to help group bloggers 'version control' their content with GitHub...
  • content management with version control 2 - ... and then I wrote a follow-up post, processing the feedback I got on Twitter and the likes.
  • mephisto - Remember Mephisto, that blog engine based on Rails? It has been forked & revived by Sebastian Gräßl, so take a look!

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
22/5 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the fifth edition:

Andy:
  • Git Tools - Debugging with Git - Git helps finding the commit that broke your tests. Its like debugging on steroids
  • gti - The sl for git.
  • equatable - Allows ruby objects to implement equality comparison and inspection methods.
Tony:
  • Crafting Rails 4 Applications - Pragmatic Bookshelf beta: Expert Practices for Everyday Rails Development
  • Python 3 Metaprogramming (youtube) - David Beazley gives a 3 hour live tutorial - informative and funny!
  • explain.depesz.com - A tool for finding a real cause for slow queries. (for PostgreSQL, what else?)
Floor:
  • HTMLify - Turn your code into pluggable HTML.
  • LearnStreet - If you'd care to refresh your JavaScript knowledge or - like yours truly - want to take Python for a spin.
  • The Rails View - As discussed in Ruby Rogues episode 104: The Rails View. On my birthday wishlist.
